Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: Someone better call the police.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Deng wa lu yun cai-shen wu.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: ...wish they all could be California... wish they all could be California girls...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I warned you about playing that shit when I'm in the car.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: That was my CD.  Don't you ever touch a Chinese man's CD.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Did you see the way those girls drove off?  I did you a favor.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Those girls drove off because of you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: All I did was invite them for a drink.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You invited them to get naked and sacrifice a small goat.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I said that?  Which word was "goat?"

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You owe me a copy of the Beach Boys Greatest Hits, Volume Two.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't be giving me attitude, Lee.  I've been here three days and we haven't done shit.  We haven't been to a club, haven't even talked to a girl.  I'm on vacation, and I want some mu-shu.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Mu-shu?  You're hungry?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Not Mu-shu.  Mu-shu.  I want to see some women.  Now stop playing dumb and show me the shu!

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: Lee, there was a bombing at the American Embassy.  Two American translators were killed.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Any leads?

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: We think it's Ricky Tan.  If you don't want to take the case, I'll understand.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's my responsibility.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What was that?  Did you just pick up a case?  Did we just take another damn case on my vacation?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Of course not.  My Superindendent invited us to a club tonight.  Big party.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't be messing with me, Lee.  I will kick your ass.  I'll hit you so hard you'll end up in the Ming Dynasty.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter, would I lie to you?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's what I'm talking about.  A real Hong Kong night club.  You want an Altoid?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You better take one.  Your breath has been a little funky all day.  Let me look at you.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Take this.  It's a Magnum.  You can fold it in half.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'll meet you at the bar in ten minutes. They don't like tourists in here, so try to blend in.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Blend in?  I'm two feet taller than everyone here.  Where you going?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Bathroom.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How you boys doing tonight?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter, get off that stage!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Are you kidding, they love me.  I'm a star, Lee.  A god to these people!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: This is a gangster bar, we're here undercover.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I knew you were lying.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Damn it, why are you ruining my night? I'm just starting to have fun.  Well fine then, go ahead, pull your badge and do your thing.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No, we're here for information, to find out where a man named Ricky Tan is.  We must tread softly and keep our ears open.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Tread softly?  Who taught you how to roost a bar?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter, you don't understand.  These men are Fu-Cang-Long Triads.  Part of the most deadly gang in China.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Man, are you crazy?  You think that scares me?  I'm from  L.A.  We invented gangs.  We were having gang wars before anybody even thought about it.  We get royalties from other gangs.  Now gimme your badge and gun and I'll show you how it's done.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.  You are a civilian.  In China, I am Michael Jackson, and you are Toto.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You mean Tito.  We had  Toto for dinner last night.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You just said you're their worst nightmare - and to line their mothers up for a milking.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Shit.  C'mon, get up here and help me out.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Stop!  LAPD!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hang on, Lee.  I'm coming.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Freeze!  Nobody move!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Try to land on your feet.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I can't believe I flew ten-thousand miles for this shit.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You lied to me.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're sorry.  I got somebody's old chopsticks stuck in my ass, so don't tell me you're sorry.  Just take me home.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No time.  There was an explosion at the American Embassy today -- two American translators were killed.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So that Ricky Tan, he's the one who blew up the Embassy?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm telling you right now, I'm tired of this shit.  There's two billion Chinese - let one of them be your partner.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: This won't take long.

Speaker: master fu
Dialogue: Dragon kick!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Yes, Master.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I was watching you kids.  My name is Carter, LAPD, and I'm a third degree black belt.  At least that's what I tell the girls at the Holiday Health Spa where I work out.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I need your help, Master.  I'm seeking a man who used to train with you.  He's become a killer - the worst kind of animal.

Speaker: master fu
Dialogue: Animals kill only from hunger or fear. The man you seek is lower than a serpent.  ...he kills for money.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Ricky Tan?

Speaker: master fu
Dialogue: No.  Your father.  Your father and Ricky Tan were my favorite students... and for such awful things to happen as they did --

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: How do I find Ricky Tan?

Speaker: master fu
Dialogue: A seeding spends its entire life reaching towards Heaven.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I know, Master, but...

Speaker: master fu
Dialogue: The answers you seek can be found in Heaven on Earth.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Heaven on Earth?  Master, I don't understand.  A temple, where Heaven is on Earth?  A mountain, where Earth reaches for the --

Speaker: master fu
Dialogue: It's a massage parlor downtown.  "Heaven on Earth."  You will find your answers there.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: And that's how you use the LAPD choke hold.  Now start practicing and don't make me come back here!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter...you ready to have some fun!?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Just follow my lead and act like a tourist.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I am a tourist.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: Good afternoon, gentlemen.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Hello.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How you doin'?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: My friend is on vacation, from America. I want to show him a good time.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: Oh, you American?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: You bring American money?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee, this one's on me.  You save your money.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: You get massage from Chinese girl before?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: No.  It's my first time.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: You pick any girl for you and your friend.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Any girl?  Okay.  Let's start with that one.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: Oh yes, she's very nice.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: She is nice.  But I am very tense.  I'm gonna need a lot of massages.  I'll take that one, too.  How you doin', baby? And...that one in pink.  She can do my feet.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What are you doing?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: She said I could pick any girl I want.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Well, hurry up.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hey!  You don't break in front of a black man in a buffet line.

Speaker: hostess
Dialogue: Please put these on and wait upstairs in the quiet room.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Now I'm on vacation.  I knew you'd come through, Lee.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Over there -- that's Ricky Tan.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's Ricky Tan?  He's four feet tall. I'll go over with you right now, shake him down.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: This is a very dangerous man.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm a dangerous man.  You're not gonna ruin my massage because of some midget in a house coat.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm calling for back up!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Ricky Tan, I've been looking all over for you.  Get up.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: I'm busy at the moment.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I said get on your feet!

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: I know you, Detective Carter, right? You're Lee's American friend.  Enjoying your visit?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm Lee's new muscle, his right arm -- and don't let the robe fool you.  This is the only color they had left.  Now get up!

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Lee, I've missed you, brother.  I heard about the two Americans, I'm so sorry, you must be under great pressure.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You must come with me for questioning.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Let's go.  I've got girls and chicken and hot oil waiting for me.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: I don't think so...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'd like to pay you for that laptop.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: It's no problem.  But I must excuse myself, inspector.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's Chief Inspector, he got promoted.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Congratulations.  And good day.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Damn!  No wonder you're pissed off.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Goddamn you got a small ass.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Don't look at my ass!

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: This is still Hong Kong.

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: Chief Inspector Lee will brief your people...

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: That is...Chief Inspector Lee.  The detective in charge of our investigation.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Back to Heaven on Earth.  I need my damn passport back.  I'm going home.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Fine.  Go home.  Who needs you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Why you mad at me?  You needed back-up, so I backed you up.  I was about to take out Ricky Tan and those bodyguards.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Stop!  I'm sick of your bullshit!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: My bullshit?  I'm not the one who goes to a karaoke bar filled with gangsters! I'm not the one who goes to massage parlors to bust crime lords!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's my job!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're pathetic, man.  When's the last time you had some fun?  When's the last time you took a night off, had a date?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I have plenty of dates.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Really?  When's the last time you had some Mu-shu  Let's hear it, Lee, when was it?  Year of the rat?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You would never understand my life. You're not Chinese.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: And you ain't black!

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: Lee, this is Special Agent Sterling from the United States Secret Service.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: The Secret Service?  Why?

Speaker: sterling
Dialogue: What I'm about to tell you cannot leave this room.  The men who were killed yesterday were not American translators. They were undercover U.S. customs agents trying to break a Triad smuggling ring. We don't know what they're transporting out of Hong Kong, but whatever it is, it got the agents killed.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: How can we help?

Speaker: sterling
Dialogue: Stay the hell out of our way.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I can get to Ricky Tan.

Speaker: sterling
Dialogue: We know all about Tan.  That's why we're leaving him out there as bait.  We think this is a lot bigger than just Ricky Tan and his Fu-Cang-Long Triads.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Captain, you're gonna have to speak up. I'm on a car phone!

Speaker: captain diel
Dialogue: Is it true, Carter?  Are you in Hong Kong right now?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hong Kong?  I'm not in Hong Kong.  I'm in Hollywood -- right at Sunset and Vine, two minutes from the station.  How about I pick you up right now and take you to dinner?

Speaker: captain diel
Dialogue: It's nine-thirty in the morning.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Did I say dinner?  I meant diner. Biscuits and gravy, you love that shit.

Speaker: captain diel
Dialogue: Do you know what happened yesterday, Carter?  I was officially nominated for the Commissioner's post for the LAPD. There was a dinner last night, two hundred LAPD officers were there.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Two hundred cops?  Was Mario Sanchez there?  He owes me money.

Speaker: captain diel
Dialogue: I've waited my whole life for this job, but I don't have a shot in hell of getting it.  Do you know why?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Is it because of the hookers, sir?  You tell them there's no crime in being lonely.

Speaker: captain diel
Dialogue: No, Carter.  The reason I'm screwed is because the entire department is about to find out the stolen credit cards we impounded were used to buy two first class upgrades to Hong Kong.  And what the hell is Heaven on Earth?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Sir, I'm working on a big case over here -- and by the time I get back they're gonna make you Governor.  Captain, you there?  Hello?  Shit!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How you doing?  Can you direct me to the Heaven on Earth massage parlor?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter!  CARTER!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How you doing?  I'm looking for Heaven on Earth.

Speaker: man
Dialogue: You wish to spank my sister with a ping pong paddle?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: No man, I was just asking...

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Wait here.  I'll go see if she's awake.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: All he wanted was some mu-shu.

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: Are you okay, Lee?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I have to go.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm gonna solve this case myself.  Taxi!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Follow that limo.

Speaker: cab driver
Dialogue: Now you speak my language.

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: Lee, we just got a call from the harbor patrol.  Ricky Tan is throwing a little party on his boat tonight.  Victoria harbor.  If you don't want to...

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Did you tell Sterling?

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: Let him find out on his own.  I want the Hong Kong police handling this.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Stay here.  I'll be right back.  You understand?

Speaker: cab driver
Dialogue: Yes.  I understand.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm with the band.  I'm the lead singer.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I got held up at a wedding in Tai Koo. Ricky here yet, I need to get his requests.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Last party all he wanted was Sting -- not one person danced.  Tonight I'm doing Superfreak, I don't care what he says.  Where is he?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Help?  I'm not the help, man -- I'm the star.  That's my band up there -- I control the mood, the groove, the atmosphere.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How you doing, baby?  My name is Prince Mubutu from Nigeria.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Isabella Molina, from San Juan.  That seat is taken.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: San Juan!  You must know my good friend Pedro Martinez Hernandez Hector Elizondo.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I don't think so.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm sorry, you looked like you traveled in the best circles.  But hey, I understand.  Make yourself at home, Isabella.  Champagne, caviar, whatever you want.  My ship is your ship.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: This is your ship?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's right.  I'm the owner, the Captain -- you can call me El Capitan.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: El Capitan?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I don't want to play games with you, Isabella.  I like you.  I can see myself with you -- in one of those bathrooms over there in about five minutes.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Well, I'm very tempted.  It's such a beautiful yacht.  What's it called?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Called?  What's my ship called?  Well...it's called the S.S. Minnow Johnson.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: The S.S. Minow Johnson.  Funny, the name on the back was "Red Dragon."

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Red Dragon?  You sure about that?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I'm sure, because this is my friend's yacht.  And it's his party.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Your friend's ship?  Oh, man.  I must've walked onto the wrong yacht.  I knew there was a reason my keys didn't work.

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: Who's your friend?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Somebody who got on the wrong yacht.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Wait a second.  You're Steven Reign? You're big time.  You own all them big hotels.  What are you doing in Hong Kong?

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: I'm just in town for the weekend, taking in the sights.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Enjoy the party, Mr. Carter.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Ricky Tan.  Where is he?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: The Hong Kong Police.  He killed a detective today and he's not getting away with it.  Now where is he?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah.  Tell us!  And don't play games or we'll kick your lying ass!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Who died?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Detective Yu?  Never met him.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Not Yu.  You!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Do you understand the words that are coming out of my mouth?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Nobody understands the words that are coming out of your mouth.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Come on, Shaq, hit a damn free-throw! You can do it, big guy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I ain't his partner, I'm a tourist.  I got proof.  See, I got a mini-bar key.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'll meet you on the main deck in ten minutes.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What, leave you alone so he can cap you?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm okay, you go.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Why the hell should you believe him?  He had us beat up.  Naked.  That's nasty shit.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Remember I told you my father was a policeman?  Ricky Tan was his partner for ten years.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What the hell is going on here?

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Despite what people suspect...what you suspect --

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Don't.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: ... if your father were alive, I would be turning to him now.  There is a war going on within the Triads -- and I am going to lose.  My name has been written into the book of death.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: The police can protect you.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Nobody can protect me.  I'll make a deal with you, Lee.  But only iff you'll get me out of Hong Kong.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Tell me why they killed the customs agents.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: There is a ship, in the Hong Kong Harbor...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: All right, get your hands up.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You wanna piece of me?  C'mon, I'll give you a little LAPD ass kickin'.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Hu Li!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What "revenge" is he talking about?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hey, you, Secret Service Man, what are you --

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Fine with me.

Speaker: superindendent chin
Dialogue: I'm sorry Lee, but my orders are to fully cooperate with the Secret Service.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'll take him.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hell no.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Don't push me, Carter.  I'm in no mood for your bullshit.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What are you gonna do about it, grasshopper?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'll bitch slap you into Bangkok.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Give me your best shot, you flat assed mama's boy.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Don't be talking about my mama.  Or my ass!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I heard your mama pulls a rickshaw.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.  She's a school teacher.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're not very good at this, are you?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Good at what?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Forget it.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Five years ago, my father was Chief Inspector working a big international smuggling case.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Ask me if I give a shit.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Ricky Tan killed my father.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How the hell did Tan get away with it?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: All the evidence against him disappeared, the smuggling case was unsolved.  Tan resigned and went over to the Triads openly.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: This is about more than all that, isn't it?  This is about your Daddy's last case, right?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No, no, that would be crazy --

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You thought the "Customs Agents get blown up" and "smuggling" and "Ricky Tan" and you put it all together and came up with a five year old case. That's why you didn't tell me what we were doing...

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I thought you'd think it was crazy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: IT IS CRAZY!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I know.  I know.  I am sorry.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So are you getting on the plane or not?!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Come on, we still got time to order the Kosher meal.  Always get the kosher meal, they bring it first.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I cannot go to LA...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It sounds impossible --

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You said --

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: -- but if somebody gave me the chance to square up my father's death, I'd go to hell to do it.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Why LA?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I guess you're going to have to trust me on this one.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I should go back.  Ricky Tan mentioned a boat in Hong Kong Harbor...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee, let me introduce you to the Carter Theory of Criminal Investigation: Follow the Rich White Man.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Follow the Rich White Man?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Almost, but you've got to say "Rich White Man" all run together like it's one word.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Follow the RichWhiteMan...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Not bad.  Now every crime, somewhere, has a rich white man taking his cut. Every single one.  Now in our case, we know the rich white man is Steven Reign.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Big hotel billionaire.  He was on Ricky Tan's boat ordering Hu Li around just before Ricky got smoked.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: How do you know he's our man?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Because when the shooting started he was way too cool.  See most white people, when there's shooting, they either hide in a toilet or start screaming high pitched like "Aaaahhh!!! Aaaahh!!!!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You sound like that all the time.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Black people keep their cool when the shit goes down.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Maybe.  But not like Asians.  We never panic.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah, what about when Godzilla was coming?  You people were screaming your asses off.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Just tell me where I can find this Steven Reign.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: The same place you find all RichWhiteMen.  Gefilte Fish.  Lox and bagel.  I love this stuff.  Here, try it with a smear.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah, that's definitely the woman from Ricky Tan's boat, and she's staying in his suite at his hotel, I told you this would work out.  They still just talking?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: He just left.  Kissed her on the cheek.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: He'll be back soon.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: How do you know?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Look at her.  Now, wake me in an hour, I'll take over.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter, there's something I have to tell you.  You were right about what you said in Hong Kong.  All I do is work.  Never take a day off.  It's all I have right now.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hey, I didn't mean to call you pathetic.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: The truth is, I haven't had any mu-shu in six months.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You pull a muscle or something?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: My fiancee left me over the summer -- a month before our wedding.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm sorry, Lee.  Why did she leave you?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's a long story.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Let me guess, she couldn't handle the cop thing -- never knowing if you were dead or alive.  I've seen it a million times.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.  It was my singing.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: She hated my voice.  Said it drove her crazy.  I sang to her all the time - in bed - in the shower - I thought she liked it.  She finally told me it was driving her crazy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee, maybe it's best if we don't discuss our personal lives.  Let's die curious.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: She's just standing around -- not doing much.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Just don't fall asleep.  Sooner or later something's gonna happen.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'll try to stay awake.  It's so boring.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What did you say?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Nothing.  I said nothing.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hot?  I'm freezing my ass off.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm gonna go in the hall and get a bucket of ice.  You want some ice?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: She's getting undressed.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Gimme the binoculars.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.  It's not right.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Gimme the binoculars or I will shoot you.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What's she doing?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Oh, sweet glory hallelujah...

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I don't want to hear this.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Skirt just came off.  She's in black bra and panties -- Victoria Secret Spring Catalogue, page 27 -- wait a sec - there's a tattoo on her left thigh... it looks like Snoopy.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Snoopy?  I love Snoopy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: She just took her hair down.  Now she's going for the bra -- the clasp is in front -- she's using both hands.  You better get that ice.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: That's enough.  We shouldn't be doing this!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: This is our job.  We took an oath as police officers.  If we don't do this, who will?  Firemen?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: She's reaching into her panties -- something is strapped to her leg.  Oh, God...please don't let it be a dick.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: No, I don't believe this shit -- it's a microphone.  Lee, she's wired...

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I don't understand?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: She's walking back towards the door.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Damn girl, you fine.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: GET DOWN!!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Pick it up!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's your turn!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I don't need a turn!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Throw it!

Speaker: hotel guests
Dialogue: Do you want us to hold the elevator?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Get the hell away from here!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Stairs!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Get out of the building!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Roof!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Wait!  There's people down there!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: There's people up here!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Get it out of here!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Take it!

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Get on your feet.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I wouldn't do that!!!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's a bomb.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: You see, no bomb.  Now stay away before I throw you both in jail for obstruction.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Throw us in jail?  I'm about to bust you right now.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I'm an undercover agent for the United States Secret Service.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How do we know you're not lying?  Let me see your badge.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: We can help you.  I'm a detective in Hong Kong.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I know who you are, Inspector Lee.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Then you know I'm not walking away from this case.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah, that's right.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: We need to get out of sight.  Come down to my suite.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Look, I've been working this case for months now...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So what's your story?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: They think I'm a crooked customs agent.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Is this a payoff?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: No.  It's a sample.  You guys ever heard of the Superbill?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It's a myth.  Some kind of counterfeit.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: It's much more than a counterfeit.  14 out of 15 world banks can't tell the difference.  The paper is Crane linen blend -- and the bills are printed on U.S. Intaglio presses.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How're they getting into the U.S. Mint to use the presses?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: In 1959, the United States was very friendly with the Shah of Iran.  We wanted his oil, so for the Shah's birthday, the government gave him a gift -- a U.S. Treasury Intaglio press.  The only one to ever leave the country. Five years ago Ricky Tan bought that press on the black market.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Five years ago?!  That's right before he left the force.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: It wasn't hard to spot the fakes until this past year.  Then Tan got hold of one of a kind Swiss made hundred dollar plates -- and started making superbills.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: And Hu Li killed him for the plates.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Yes.  They've printed and shipped one hundred million dollars, and there's only one way to spot a fake.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What the hell are they going to do with a hundred million dollars in funny money?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: The real question is, where are the plates?  If we can find the plates, we can stop the whole operation.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Lee and Carter are officially out of the Secret Service's way...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Secret Service Agent Carter.  This is my calling, Lee. Give me six months and I'll be in Washington protecting a white guy.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: We both know you would never take a bullet for someone else.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: They don't know that.  What are they gonna do, try and shoot the President during the interview?  I'll bet Isabella can pull some strings.  You saw the way she was staring at me.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: She never even looked at you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're just jealous 'cos the girl picked me.  I'm tall, dark and handsome, you're third world ugly.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I am not third world ugly.  Women like me, they think I'm cute.  Like Snoopy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Snoopy is about six inches taller than you.  I'm sorry, Lee, you never had a chance.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Kenny!  How you doin'?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: This is where I say I'm LAPD in a loud voice, they all scream and run and shit. Watch.  It's real funny.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Come with me.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Hear you got your ass kicked in Hong Kong, James.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What??  Where'd you hear that?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I got my sources.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: And I got mine, meaning you.  Nice how that works out.  I'm serious this time, I'm closing this place down.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: James, you see my kids back there?  You know how much I'm paying for private school?  How can you come in here with this attitude, you being little Chang's godfather?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Little Chang is gonna have to go visit his daddy in jail if you don't cooperate.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Jail!?  James, you better back off. Badge or no badge, I'll kick your ass.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'd like to see you try.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: We're on, then.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: That's a good Twisting Tiger -- where did you learn that?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Master Ching taught me.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: The Praying Mantis school, in Bejing?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: No.  Freddy Ching's, in Crenshaw.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Baby Duck?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: That's what we all used to call him when he was a kid -- cause he was always quacking.  Never shut up.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I heard that.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: Is this about the funny money?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How'd you know?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You've been asking loud questions in all the wrong places all morning.  How come you always save me for last, James? When are you gonna learn.  Shit don't happen I don't know about.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: So tell me what you know.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I know Teddy Wu is cranking out a pretty good double sawbuck -- but you knew that too, didn't you?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah.  We already been there.  This is big, Kenny.  Benjamins.  Secret Service calls 'em superbills.  Banks can't even tell the difference.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: One of my regulars lost fifty thousand dollars at the table here last week.  I was about to send my boys down to tune his ass up, when the guy comes in and pays off the whole thing.  Including the vig -- brand new sequential hundred dollar bills.  I knew something was wrong.  Cause this guy's got a regular job, no way he comes up with fifty grand in cash. But I tested the bills, infrared.  The whole thing.  And they checked out. 100%.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Do you still have the bills?

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: I still have my lunch money from third grade.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lemme see 'em.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: See.  It's perfect.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: All right, Kenny.  Thanks.  You're off the hook.  For now.

Speaker: kenny
Dialogue: You sure you guys don't want to stay and have a bite?  My wife's got the best mu shu this side of Compton.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: We're looking for a guy named Zing.  Is he here?

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: The great Chief Inspector Lee -- I will be remembered for ridding the Triads of your petulance.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I hope you just said I have no business being here, 'cos I was just leaving.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Hu Li, I think there's someone who will want to talk to them first.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: ...oh, that's a filling right there. That's gonna cost you.

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: Put them in the truck.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I should kill you right now, but I'm gonna let you live, 'cause you're fine, and maybe you can be reformed.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What's the first thing I told you -- never trust nobody.  How could you fall for that shit?  I knew she was dirty.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: She saved our lives.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: For how long?  Face it, Lee, she's playing both sides.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Shhh, my head hurts.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm about to be killed and you "Shhh" me!  This wasn't my case, Lee.  Ricky Tan didn't kill my father, the Fu-Cang Long are not in South Central.  I didn't have to help you.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Why did you help me?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It doesn't matter.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I'm not used to having a partner.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: We are not partners.  Between your daddy, my daddy, and the beating I just took, as far as I can tell all partners get you is dead.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Well we're not friends.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You got that right.  And we ain't brothers.  Maybe we should just end this right here.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Fine with me.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I won't talk to you, you don't talk to me.  We'll die in peace.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: See you in the next world.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I don't believe in reincarnation.  So I won't see you in the next world.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I believe in heaven.  You people believe in heaven?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Yes.  We have heaven.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Is it the same heaven, or is it a Chinese heaven?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What's a Chinese heaven?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I thought it might be like those five foot and under basketball leagues.  They don't let everybody in.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I think we should stop talking.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Fine by me.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: If she was the right girl, you'd be thinking about her.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Mind your own business.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How was the sex?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: There was no sex.  She was very traditional.  We were waiting until we were married.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're kidding.  No sex?  Nothing?  No mu-shu?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No mu-shu.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What about a little king pao chicken?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No kung pao chicken.  Never.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Steamed dumplings?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Once in a while, steamed dumplings.  But only when she was drunk.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That's rough, man.  If I don't get steamed dumplings once a week, I go crazy.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Tell me the truth, Carter.  Do you think I have a good voice?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Are you serious?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Forget it.  It doesn't matter.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: As long as you're asking...I think you have a pretty good voice.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I knew it.  What does she know.  You want me to sing something?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That depends.  How do the Fu-Cang-Long usually kill their victims?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: They'll probably torture us first, shock our privates, then put two bullets in our eyes and one in the back of the head.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Go ahead.  Sing your ass off.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Did you happen to see the most beautiful girl in the world...and if you did, was she crying, crying...hey!

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: Don't worry, the plates are safe.  Yes, the dragon's been fed.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Very nice.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's focus.  Every opponent has a weak spot.  You ignore everything around you, and put all your energy into one perfect strike.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'll remember that next time I'm fighting a box.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Who's Benjamin?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Benjamin Franklin, he discovered electricity.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: A Chinese man discovered electricity.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: No Chinese man discovered electricity.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Yes he did.  He also invented the bicycle.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Now that I believe.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: We're slowing down.  This must be it.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: End of the line.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You've been a good friend, James Carter.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Oh no you don't.  Don't you be getting corny on me, Lee.  I'll kick your ass from here to Compton.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: You could never kick my ass.  You mama's boy.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't you talk about my mama.  That's more like it.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: This way.  I see some lights.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Vegas...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee.  I just got an idea how someone could launder a hundred million dollars in cash.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Red Dragon.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That was the name of Ricky Tan's boat.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Let's go.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Wait a second.  We can't go in like this.  Look at this place, we gotta look fly.  We gotta Mac out.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What is Mac out?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Follow me my Asian brother.

Speaker: salesman
Dialogue: May I help you gentlemen?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Black.  42-long.  Nothing touches this body but pure silk.  And get my partner something from the children's department.

Speaker: salesman
Dialogue: Would your partner like silk as well?  I personally like it when a couple matches.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Couple?  No, you got it wrong, there's no couple here.  Just two single police officers working a very dangerous case.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Yes.  We have lots of big men chasing us.

Speaker: salesman
Dialogue: I'm sure all the boys are chasing you two.  Don't worry, I'll make you guys the bell of the ball.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: This is the last time I go shopping with you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Remember, Lee, you're a player now.  You own the place.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I own the place.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That looks exactly like my Uncle Darrell.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Buddha is the symbol of luck and good fortune.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Buddha is the symbol for fat and lazy. The man has the biggest tits in Asia.

Speaker: sign
Dialogue: $50,000 buy in -- EVERYBODY'S A WINNER!

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: A thousand years ago, a small, wealthy village in China hired a young Dragon to guard their treasure in a cave, hoping to scare off potential bandits.  Their plan worked quite well, until the people of the village started sneaking the Dragon extra food -- hoping to make him bigger and stronger.  The Dragon ate so much and grew so big -- that he eventually got stuck inside the cave -- and the treasure was stuck behind him for all eternity.  Ladies and gentlemen, I have found that lost treasure.  It is here, inside the greatest casino in the world!  Welcome to the Red Dragon, where everybody is a winner!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Give me ten dollars in nickels.

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Winner!  Seven!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Look at this place, Lee.  The biggest front in the world.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter...here comes the rich white man.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Wait here.  I'll handle this.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Put your arms around me.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Hold me close.  There's cameras everywhere.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I need your help.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Last time you needed my help I ended up in the back of a truck.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I'm undercover.  I had no choice.  You have to trust me.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Just trying to make it look real.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Look over there.  That's the eye in the sky room.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Why don't you go get them?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: If I'm wrong then my cover is blown.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Stevie, how's it going my man?  Somebody get a picture, we can use it for a mug shot.

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: Detective Carter, you always seem to show up where you don't belong.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lemme ask you something, Steven.  And I want the truth.  Is there any way I can date your daughter?  Just dinner and a movie, maybe go listen to some jazz...

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: Vegas has been my town for 30 years.  I crawled out from under the first rock. Do you really think you can intimidate me here?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You're right, you're a smart guy.  Most counterfeiters only get ten cents on the dollar.  But this is an even swap.  Pure genius.

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: You play games with me, Detective, and you'll lose every time.  Don't forget. The odds are always in favor of the house.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: The Secret Service almost busted Reign at his casino in Macao, but the place burned down before we could move in.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: How do I know I can trust you?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Dip me!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.  But I'll help you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee, what the hell are you doing?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Dancing?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Dancing?  I'm out here trying to strong arm Steven Reign, putting my life on the line, and you're up here dancing with some bimbo.  Did she have a friend?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It was Isabella.  She says the plates are in the soft count room.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Isabella?  Are you crazy, man?  She almost got us killed.  She's setting you up again!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No.  I'm going to find out.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Wait a second.  There's guards all over the place.  You'll need a distraction.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Try to keep them busy for five minutes.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'll give it my best shot.

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Sir, you're aware that we require a fifty-thousand dollar buy in to gamble here this weekend?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I saw the sign, I can read.  Now gimme a hundred-thousand in chips.  And a Diet Coke and some wash-n-dries.  Let's move, people, I came to play.

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Those are five hundred dollar chips.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Did you give me five-hundred dollar chips because I'm black?

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: No, I just assumed...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You assumed a brother coming in here can only afford five-hundred dollars a roll, is that right?  Are you a racist?

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: No, sir.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Everyone else at the table has thousand dollar chips, but the black man gets the nickel, is that it?  Did my people survive two-hundred years of slavery so you could send us back to the cotton fields with five-hundred dollar chips? Do I look like Chicken George to you?

Speaker: pit boss
Dialogue: Floor security, we have a problem at table nine.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Answer me one question.  How come Ben Vereen isn't performing here at the hotel?  Is Ben Vereen not good enough for you people?

Speaker: pit boss
Dialogue: Lionel Ritchie is performing here tonight.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lionel Ritchie hasn't been black since the Commodores.

Speaker: pit boss
Dialogue: Sir, you're going to have to calm down.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I have a dream, where black people and white people can gamble together without getting different chips!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Hi.  How's it going?  You guys have change for a twenty?

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: Open your mouth.

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Winner six!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: How much is that?

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Two-hundred thousand!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Two-hundred thousand dollars?  Who wants a hundred dollars?

Speaker: gambler
Dialogue: I am not royalty, sir.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't say that, we're all royalty.  My great grandmammy was Queen Nephertit -- we probably cousins, man.  How much you got on the table?

Speaker: gambler
Dialogue: One million.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Yeah, we definitely cousins now.  Who wants to blow on my hand for luck?

Speaker: texan
Dialogue: She's not my lady.  She's my niece.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Can I come over for Thanksgiving?  Come on, baby, give me some luck.

Speaker: texan
Dialogue: Hey, buddy, watch yourself.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Don't threaten me.  I got friends in this town that will bite off your ears. Just sit tight, because I've got the dice and I am on fire!

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Winner, seven!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Let it ride!

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Imagine a business where people hand you money.  And you hand them back absolutely nothing.

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: He's going for the plates.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Look at this old fool, what does he think he's doing?

Speaker: craps dealer
Dialogue: Winner!  Four, winner!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm up a hundred and fifty-grand. That's a Ferrari.  Do they sell those here in the gift shop?  Somebody cash me out!

Speaker: pit boss
Dialogue: Sir, we'd like to escort you to the cashier.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That would be great.  Don't want any of these rich white people to jump me.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Chai Hu Li.  Have fun.

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: In a few minutes...you'll beg me to push this button.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: It's time to end this, Inspector.

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: Get the detonator!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee!!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Black man gets on a hot streak and you're all trippin'?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: MMMMMM!!!!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Check it out.  Catfight!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What the HELL are you doing with tape on your face?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Bomb!!!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Why didn't you tell me you had a bomb in your mouth?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I did!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: No you didn't!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Yes I did.  I said MMMMMM!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: What?!?!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: We have to get to the Penthouse.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hold on!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter...

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Just GO!

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I didn't know which side you were on.

Speaker: isabella
Dialogue: Now you know.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: American's love to gamble.  Don't they, Mr. Reign?

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: I'm cutting our deal short.  I'm leaving.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: And my plates?

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: They stay with me.  I'm sure you won't have a problem with that.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: I enjoyed that little story you told about the Dragon and the treasure.  My mother used to tell it to me all the time.  Do you know the moral of that story, Mr. Reign?

Speaker: steven reign
Dialogue: Greed will imprison us all.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: I hate that fortune cookie shit.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Put the plates down.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Will you STOP?!?!  What am I supposed to fight you with?

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: You're just like your father, Lee.  All these years hiding behind his badge.  I wanted to help him, to share with him, but he was too afraid of change.  When you think about it, I didn't really kill him.  I just put him out of his misery.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Put the plates down.  It's over.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: I don't think it's over.  There are casinos all over this country.  Let me make you a rich man, Lee.  Don't make the same mistake he did.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: If you reach for that gun, I'm going to kill you.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Don't you remember?  I'm already dead.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Hey, Ricky, how's it going man?  What's up, Lee?

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Would you like me to tell you how your father died?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee, you okay?

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: He never begged for his life.  Or tried to make a deal.  All that he asked me, just seconds before I pulled the trigger, was that I promise not to kill you.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Lee, wait a second.  It's not worth it, man.  He's making you do this.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's worth it to me.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: Do you have it in you, Lee?  Or are you gonna spend the rest of your life hiding like your father?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: C'mon, Lee.  He's going to jail.  You won, now just put the gun down.

Speaker: ricky tan
Dialogue: That's what I thought.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I don't know about you, but I need a wine cooler.

Speaker: hu li
Dialogue: We'll go together, Inspector.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Please tell me she just asked for a ride to the airport.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I can't believe I flew ten-thousand miles for this shit!!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: We made it, man.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No problem.

Speaker: versace salesman
Dialogue: Well, there is a God after all.

Speaker: limo driver
Dialogue: Here we are.  The Red Dragon hotel.

Speaker: versace salesman
Dialogue: We're all going gambling and then to see Siegried and Roy.  I hope you two are feeling lucky!

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I saw that.  She kissed you, didn't she? You played it cool, though.  Walking away, never looking back.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: She's going home to New York.  I need some ice.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: That your gate down there?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: I'm this way.  I guess this is goodbye.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I guess so.  Thank you, Carter.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: You take care of yourself, Lee.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Carter, wait.  There's something I want you to have.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Your father's badge?  No way, man.  I can't take this.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: It's okay.  I can finally let it go.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: In that case, I got something for you. I picked it up at the hotel.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: About fifty grand.  I won it at the tables.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: No, Carter.  I can't take this.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: It's okay, I got lots more.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: This money is evidence.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Come on, Lee.  Stop being a cop for five minutes and live it up.  There must be something you want.

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: I always wanted to go to Madison Square Garden.  See the Knicks play.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: New York City?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: First class.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: The Plaza Hotel?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: A little Mu-shu.

Speaker: carter
Dialogue: Some Kung-Pao?

Speaker: lee
Dialogue: Amen to that, brother.
